subject: Climate & Environment
title: Southeast Asian Rainforests
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Southeast Asian Rainforests.

hook.text: Borneo's rainforest is 140 million years old â€” older than the Amazon by 80 million years.

buildup.text: Southeast Asia holds some of the highest biodiversity per square meter on the planet.

discovery.text: Orangutans, tigers, and rhinoceros all depend on these forests for survival.

twist.text: Palm oil plantations have replaced over 30% of Borneo's original forest since 1973.

climax.text: Southeast Asia has the highest deforestation rate of any tropical region.

punchline.text: The oldest rainforest on Earth is vanishing the fastest.
